title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: There's water, ma'am, to wash yer face ; an' I'll dish up the jeuks that Rory Maclean shot twa days ago in the swamp, and they're mair tender than the grouse or patricks on Craig Hulich.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: The bleating of a sheep up on the very pinnacle of Craig Hulich sounded so close to Fergus, that involuntarily he started and looked round.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' And you know it's awful rough on a fellow, I always say, to have a mother like yon,' said Alastair, pointing over to Shonnen, which looked dark in the strong shadow of Craig Hulich.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: She only looked once more to Craig Hulich, sharply defined against the clear amber sky ; she could not forget that in Shonnen dwelt a woman who hated her with a terrible hatred, rendered doubly awful to Sheila, because it was the mother of Fergus Macleod who bore such causeless resentment against her.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: A golden shaft again touched the rugged shoulder of Craig Hulich.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' Do you see Craig Hulich over there, Edith ? Do you think it could walk over here and place itself in the Girron Burn?

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: It stood by the roadside, and had no garden, but only a few stunted birch trees at either side, and the gaunt, bare slope of Craig Hulich rising abruptly behind it.
